Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Autofluorescence in Thyroidectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: patients aged over 18 years undergoing total thyroidectomy were randomised 1:1

Participants.evidence: patients aged over 18 years undergoing total thyroidectomy

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1 to either the intervention group using Fluobeam速 LX or a control group without it

Objective.evidence: evaluated the use of Fluobeam速 LX for parathyroid gland visualization during total thyroidectomy to reduce postoperative hypoparathyroidism

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of low parathyroid hormone (PTH) levels on the first postoperative day.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using the Eurocrine速 platform with allocation concealed from patients.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between January 2021 and August 2022, 535 patients were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: 535 patients were randomised, and 486 were analysed (246 intervention, 240 control).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The rate of low PTH levels was 26.0% in the intervention group and 32.1% in the control group (RR 0.81, 95% CI 0.61 to 1.07; p = 0.141).

Harms.evidence: No specific harm related to Fluobeam速 LX was reported.
